intro: Odontostemma barbatum, commonly known as the African shield fern, is a tropical plant native to Africa. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its dense, shield-shaped fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its rhizome is fibrous and can form dense colonies, contributing to its ornamental value. The leaves are leathery and have a distinctive, almost metallic sheen.
